alert.note: Alert for Randolph; St. Clair; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 2:26PM CST until February 22 at 3:30PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Washington County in south central Illinois... Randolph County in southwestern Illinois... Southeastern St. Clair County in southwestern Illinois... * Until 330 PM CST. * At 226 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Baldwin to near Evansville to 6 miles east of Womac, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of Washington, Randolph and southeastern St. Clair Counties, including the following locations... Walsh, Radom, Preston, Huegely, Welge, Posen, New Minden, Eden, Oakdale and Cordes. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 50 and 61. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southwestern Illinois...and southeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southwestern Illinois...and southeastern Missouri.
